author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Communist Party of India (Marxist) Polit Bureau on Thursday, expressed “deep concern” over withdrawal of customs duty exemption for over 76 life saving drugs.

In a release, the CPI (M) said, “This gazette notification by the government has made these drugs more expensive. These drugs include anti-cancer, anti-AIDS drugs and drugs for haemophilia patients.” Demanding that the government reconsider the decision, the party said, “The government’s reasoning is that this would protect the domestic drug companies. Now the prices of life saving drugs for patients dependent on imported drugs will rise by at least 22 per cent.”
title: Restore duty cut on life-saving drugs: CPI(M)
